context_bundle.summary: Rust traits for abstraction, trait objects for dynamic dispatch, impl Trait syntax, and associated types

common_patterns: Define trait: 'trait Summary { fn summarize(&self) -> String; }'
Implement trait: 'impl Summary for Article { fn summarize(&self) -> String { format!("{} by {}", self.title, self.author) } }'
Trait bounds: 'fn notify<T: Summary>(item: &T) { println!("{}", item.summarize()); }'
Where clause: 'fn complex<T, U>(t: &T, u: &U) -> i32 where T: Display + Clone, U: Clone + Debug { /* ... */ }'
Impl Trait: 'fn returns_summarizable() -> impl Summary { Article { /* ... */ } }'
Trait objects: 'let items: Vec<Box<dyn Summary>> = vec![Box::new(article), Box::new(tweet)];'
Associated types: 'trait Iterator { type Item; fn next(&mut self) -> Option<Self::Item>; }'
known_errors: trait not implemented: Implement required trait methods, check trait bounds
cannot return impl Trait: Use Box<dyn Trait> for multiple return types
trait object not object safe: Remove generic methods or Self return types
conflicting implementations: Use newtype pattern to wrap type
lifetime issues with traits: Add lifetime parameters to trait definition
associated type not specified: Provide concrete type when implementing trait
